title: What we do
body:
Informed by Science, Compelled by Caring

Nurses are shaping the future of health care as the largest group of health care providers in Canada. We tackle the essential issues that matter—to people, places and the planet. As a nurse, you'll have the chance to directly influence the health of individuals, families and communities.

New Opportunities in Health Care 

New opportunities in health care are constantly emerging, expanding what nurses do in our communities. At the University of Guelph School of Nursing, we are committed to our students’ success. Our flexible, hands-on programs, research-inspired teaching and collaborative partnerships will accelerate your personal growth and prepare you for a successful career. Our numerous studies done on the University of Guelph nursing program and student success rate provide promising results that the program works. Provided below is a chart which depicts the student's career attainment rate in 2017.

Career Attainment Rate 2017

 
Job Status 6 Months 1 Year 2 Years
Full-Time 50% 80% 90%
Part-Time 30% 15% 5%
No Job 20% 5% 5%

As you can see in the chart above, the university does a great job at prepairing students for the workforce and administering desirable skills that employer's want with only a 5% unemployment rate after one year. 

 

Tips to Consider When applying for Jobs 

  • Research available jobs as you approach the end of your degree
  • Volunteer with multiple organizations to get connections and a sense of what's out there
  • Visit Co-operative Education and Career Services to work on your resume and interviewing skills
  • Attend job fairs to meet potential employers

 

Learning Beyond the Program

There are numerous other resources that are available for use outside of the university site to help determine if the nursing program is for you. For further understanding of just what a job in nursing entails, please visit the "Is Nursing the Right Career for You?" site. If you have any further questions or concerns about entering the nursing program, please contact Sandra Mitchell with the subject line Nursing Questions.

 

For further interest in the nursing fields in today's society, please view the doccument Nursing in the 21 Century.
